result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob T. Wenzel

records.addlTxt:
8:56 AM Court calls 22CF113 and 21CM17  Defendant Jacob T. Wenzel in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jacob T. Wenzel. Attorney Lawrence Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin. Plea agreement reviewed that was filed on 10/13/22.  Count 1 of Information reviewed in 22CF113 and Deft. enters a GUILTY Plea.  Count 2 of Information reviewed in 22CF113 and Deft. enters GUILTY Plea.  Plea quest. & waiver of rights reviewed.  Court finds plea made freely & voluntarily.  Voting/Firearms.  Court accepts plea and Deft. is adjudged guilty on Ct. 1 and 2  and orders a JOC entered into the record.  Remaining counts are dismissed read in -Ct. 3  and case 21CM117.  PSI Ordered.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob T. Wenzel in court.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jacob T. Wenzel.  Set for Plea
Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence James Lasee in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob T. Wenzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jacob T. Wenzel. Information received.  Waive reading.  NG plea entered.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:08 PM Defendant Jacob T. Wenzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jacob T. Wenzel. Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Court makes smt re 21CM17 which will follow CF case. PQW received/reviewed by the Court w/ defendant. Court finds defendant's waiver to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts waiver. Court further finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:32 AM Defendant Jacob T. Wenzel in court, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jon G Spansail in court for Jacob T. Wenzel.  PH within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Covers both files 22CF113 and 21CM17. $500 posted on 5/14/2022 @ OCSD. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages. Defendant shall not possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant shall not have direct or indirect contact w/ Cody Ludwig, D.H., and T.W. Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.

1:01 PM Defendant Jacob T. Wenzel appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. SPD Atty Hansen in court for today's hearing. Court makes stmt. Defendant does not understands repeater charges. Court reviews prior conviction w/ defendant. Defendant now understands charges/advised of right to counsel/SPD info given. Bond set.
Initial appearance scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
